pageContext.claim: “We're at -- as an example, 20 million tests. Germany is at 4 million. South Korea, which you heard so much about -- they're doing a good job -- they're at about 3 million. We're well over 20 million. Very shortly, we'll be well over 20 million tests.”
pageContext.analysis: Germany and South Korea did not to have to do as many tests because they acted quickly to test people with the disease, thus nipping it in the bud. The Trump administration bungled the testing in the early stages of the pandemic, allowing the virus to spread silently through the country.
